走.definition: to walk; to go; to run; to move (of vehicle); to visit; to leave; to go away; to die (euph.); from; through; away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3]); to change (shape, form, meaning)

走下坡路.definition: to go downhill; to decline; to slump

走丟.definition: to wander off; to get lost

走你.definition: (neologism c. 2012) (interjection of encouragement) Let’s do this!; Come on, you can do this!

走來回.definition: to make a round trip; a return journey

走俏.definition: (a product) sells well; to be in demand

走偏.definition: to deviate from the correct course; (fig.) to go astray

走偏鋒.definition: to write with the tip of the brush tilted; (fig.) to resort to devious means

走光.definition: to expose oneself; to be completely gone

走內線.definition: insider contacts; via private channels; to seek influence with sb via family members (possibly dishonest or underhand)

走出.definition: to leave (a room etc); to go out through (a door etc)

走動.definition: to walk around; to move about; to stretch one's legs; to go for a walk; to be mobile (e.g. after an illness); to visit one another; to socialize; to pay a visit (go to the toilet)

走卒.definition: pawn (i.e. foot soldier); servant; lackey (of malefactor)

走向.definition: direction; strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology); inclination; trend; to move towards; to head for

走向滑動斷層.pinyin: zou3 xiang4 hua2 dong4 duan4 ceng2
走向滑動斷層.definition: strike-slip fault (geology); fault line where the two sides slide horizontally past one another

走味兒.definition: erhua variant of 走味[zou3 wei4]

走嘴.definition: a slip of the tongue; to blurt out (a secret or stupid mistake)

走回頭路.definition: to turn back; to backtrack; (fig.) to revert to the former way of doing things

走圓場.definition: to walk around the stage (to indicate scene changes)

走失.definition: lost; missing; to lose (sb in one's charge); to get lost; to wander away; to lose (flavor, freshness, shape, hair, one's good looks etc); to lose meaning (in translation)

走娘家.definition: (of a wife) to visit one's parental home

走寶.definition: (Cantonese) to miss out on sth valuable

走山.definition: landslide; avalanche; to take a walk in the mountains

走強.definition: (of a currency, price etc) to strengthen; to be on the rise

走彎路.definition: to take an indirect route; to waste one's time by using an inappropriate method

走形.definition: out of shape; to lose shape; to deform

走形兒.definition: out of shape; to lose shape; to deform

走後門.definition: (lit.) to enter through the back door; (fig.) to pull strings; to use connections; (fig.) (slang) to have anal sex

走心.definition: to take care; to be mindful; (Internet slang) to be moved by sth; poignant; to have deep feelings for sb; to lose one's heart to sb

走扇.definition: not closing properly (of door, window etc)

走投無路.definition: to be at an impasse (idiom); in a tight spot; at the end of one's rope; desperate

走散.definition: to wander off; to stray; to get lost

走時.definition: (of a watch or clock) to keep time; (physics) propagation time; travel time (of a wave)

走板.definition: to be off the beat; to sound awful (of singing); (fig.) to wander off the topic; (diving) to step toward the end of the board; approach

走桃花運.definition: to have luck with the ladies (idiom)

走步.definition: to walk; to step; pace; traveling (walking with the ball, a foul in basketball)

走水.definition: to leak; to flow; to catch on fire

走江湖.definition: to travel around the country (as itinerant peddler or entertainer)

走漏.definition: to leak (information, secrets etc); to smuggle and evade tax; to suffer shrinkage (partial loss of goods due to theft etc)

走火.definition: to go off accidentally; to catch fire

走火入魔.definition: to be obsessed with sth; to go overboard; (Buddhism, Taoism) to misguidedly focus on hallucinations that arise during meditation

走為上.definition: see 三十六計，走為上策|三十六计，走为上策[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4]

走為上計.definition: see 三十六計，走為上策|三十六计，走为上策[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4]

走狗.definition: hunting dog; hound; (fig.) running dog; lackey

走眼.definition: a mistake; an oversight; an error of judgment

走禽.definition: Ratitae (formerly Cursores) flightless birds such as ostriches

走秀.definition: a fashion show; to walk the runway (in a fashion show)

走私.definition: to smuggle; to have an illicit affair

走穴.definition: (of itinerant entertainers) to tour, playing in many venues

走紅.definition: to be popular; to be in luck; to have good luck; to develop smoothly

走背字兒.definition: erhua variant of 走背字[zou3 bei4 zi4]

走腎.definition: (med) retractile testicle; infatuation inducing; pee inducing (of alcohol); (neologism) to be sexually attracted; to have the hots for sb

走親訪友.definition: to visit one's friends and relatives

走讀.definition: to attend school as a day student

走資派.definition: capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)

走路.definition: to walk; to go on foot; to leave; to depart; (informal) to clear off; to beat it; (of sb who gets fired or resigns) to leave the job; to get out

走近.definition: to approach; to draw near to

走運.definition: to have good luck; to be in luck

走過.definition: to walk past; to pass by

走道.definition: pavement; sidewalk; path; walk; footpath; aisle

走避.definition: to run away; to escape; to avoid

走鄉隨鄉.definition: (proverb) to follow local customs; When in Rome, do as the Romans do.

走鋼絲.definition: to walk a tightrope (literally or figuratively)

走錯.definition: to go the wrong way; to take the wrong (road, exit etc)

走門子.definition: see 走門路|走门路[zou3 men2 lu4]

走門路.definition: to use social connections; to toady to influential people

走開.definition: to leave; to walk away; to beat it; to move aside

走險.definition: to take risks; to run risks

走題.definition: to get off the main topic; to digress

走馬.definition: to ride (a horse); to go on horseback

走馬上任.definition: (idiom) to take office; to assume a post

走馬到任.definition: see 走馬上任|走马上任[zou3 ma3 shang4 ren4]

走馬燈.definition: lantern with a carousel of paper horses rotating under convection, used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节[Yuan2 xiao1 jie2]; (fig.) revolving door; musical chairs (metaphor for people being shuffled around into different jobs)

走馬看花.definition: lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation; to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information

走馬章臺.definition: to go to the brothel on horseback (idiom); to visit prostitutes

走馬觀花.definition: lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); a fleeting glance in passing; fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation; to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information

走馬赴任.definition: see 走馬上任|走马上任[zou3 ma3 shang4 ren4]
